intro: Scurrula levinei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Scurrula levinei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
